notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow for configuration manipulation.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-22-207-03 - Web Scraped Version

cwe.name: Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel

notes.text: The affected product uses the S-Bus protocol with authentication functions that can be controlled by the client MAC and IP. Because UDP is stateless, an attacker that can observe traffic can also spoof the MAC and IP of an authenticated client and manipulate the controller configuration.CVE-2022-30319 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.6 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:H/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Honeywell recommends users with affected products and unsupported products take the following steps to protect themselves:

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.

cwe.name: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

notes.text: The affected product uses the S-Bus “write byte” message to a specific address and supplies a hashed version of the password. The hashing algorithm is based on CRC-16 and, as such, is not cryptographically secure.CVE-2022-30320 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.6 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:H/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
